verses.verse: Now a man <S%H376><s%> from the house <S%H1004><s%> of Levi <S%H3878><s%> went <S%H1980><s%> and married <S%H3947><s%> a daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Levi. <S%H3878><s%>

And the woman <S%H802><s%> conceived <S%H2029><s%> and bore <S%H3205><s%> a son; <S%H1121><s%> and when she saw <S%H7200><s%> that he was beautiful, <S%H2896><s%> she hid <S%H6845><s%> him for three <S%H7969><s%> months. <S%H3391><s%>

But when she could <S%H3201><s%> hide <S%H6845><s%> him no <S%H3808><s%> longer, <S%H5750><s%> she got <S%H3947><s%> him a wicker <S%H1573><s%> basket <S%H8392><s%> and covered <S%H9146><s%> it over with tar <S%H2564><s%> and pitch. <S%H2203><s%> Then she put <S%H7760><s%> the child <S%H3206><s%> into it, and set <S%H7760><s%> [it] among the reeds <S%H5488><s%> by the bank <S%H8193><s%> of the Nile. <S%H2975><s%>
And his sister <S%H269><s%> stood <S%H3320><s%> at a distance <S%H7350><s%> to find <S%H3045><s%> out what <S%H4100><s%> would happen <S%H6213><s%> to him.

Then the daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> came <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> to bathe <S%H7364><s%> at the Nile, <S%H2975><s%> with her maidens <S%H5291><s%> walking <S%H1980><s%> alongside <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3027><s%> the Nile; <S%H2975><s%> and she saw <S%H7200><s%> the basket <S%H8392><s%> among <S%H8432><s%> the reeds <S%H5488><s%> and sent <S%H7971><s%> her maid, <S%H519><s%> and she brought <S%H3947><s%> it [to her.]

When she opened <S%H6605><s%> [it,] she saw <S%H7200><s%> the child, <S%H3206><s%> and behold, <S%H2009><s%> [the] boy <S%H5288><s%> was crying. <S%H1058><s%> And she had <S%H2550><s%> pity <S%H2550><s%> on him and said, <S%H559><s%> "This <S%H2088><s%> is one <S%H4480><s%> of the Hebrews' children. <S%H3206><s%>"

Then his sister <S%H269><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Pharaoh's daughter, <S%H1323><s%> "Shall I go <S%H1980><s%> and call <S%H7121><s%> a nurse <S%H3243><s%> for you from the Hebrew <S%H5680><s%> women, <S%H5680><s%> that she may nurse <S%H3243><s%> the child <S%H3206><s%> for you?"
And Pharaoh's daughter <S%H1323><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to her, "Go <S%H1980><s%> [ahead]." So the girl <S%H5959><s%> went <S%H1980><s%> and called <S%H7121><s%> the child's mother. <S%H517><s%>

Then Pharaoh's daughter <S%H1323><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to her, "Take <S%H1980><s%> this <S%H2088><s%> child <S%H3206><s%> away and nurse <S%H3243><s%> him for me and I shall give <S%H5414><s%> [you] your wages. <S%H7939><s%>" So the woman <S%H802><s%> took <S%H3947><s%> the child <S%H3206><s%> and nursed <S%H5134><s%> him.

And the child <S%H3206><s%> grew, <S%H1431><s%> and she brought <S%H935><s%> him to Pharaoh's daughter, <S%H1323><s%> and he became <S%H1961><s%> her son. <S%H1121><s%> And she named <S%H7121><s%> <S%H8034><s%> him Moses, <S%H4872><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%> "Because <S%H3588><s%> I drew <S%H4871><s%> him out of the water. <S%H4325><s%>"

Now it came <S%H1961><s%> about in those <S%H1992><s%> days, <S%H3117><s%> when Moses <S%H4872><s%> had grown <S%H1431><s%> up, that he went <S%H3318><s%> out to his brethren <S%H251><s%> and looked <S%H7200><s%> on their hard <S%H5450><s%> labors; <S%H5450><s%> and he saw <S%H7200><s%> an Egyptian <S%H4713><s%> beating <S%H5221><s%> a Hebrew, <S%H5680><s%> one <S%H4480><s%> of his brethren. <S%H251><s%>

So he looked <S%H6437><s%> this <S%H3541><s%> way <S%H3541><s%> and that, and when he saw <S%H7200><s%> there <S%H369><s%> was no <S%H369><s%> one <S%H376><s%> [around,] he struck <S%H5221><s%> down <S%H5221><s%> the Egyptian <S%H4713><s%> and hid <S%H2934><s%> him in the sand. <S%H2344><s%>

And he went <S%H3318><s%> out the next <S%H8145><s%> day, <S%H3117><s%> and behold, <S%H2009><s%> two <S%H8147><s%> Hebrews <S%H5680><s%> were fighting <S%H5327><s%> with each other; and he said <S%H559><s%> to the offender, <S%H7563><s%> "Why <S%H4100><s%> are you striking <S%H5221><s%> your companion <S%H7453><s%>?"

But he said, <S%H559><s%> "Who <S%H4310><s%> made <S%H7760><s%> you a prince <S%H8269><s%> or a judge <S%H8199><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> us? Are you intending <S%H559><s%> to kill <S%H2026><s%> me, as you killed <S%H2026><s%> the Egyptian <S%H4713><s%>?" Then Moses <S%H4872><s%> was afraid, <S%H3372><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%> "Surely <S%H403><s%> the matter <S%H1697><s%> has become known. <S%H3045><s%>"

When Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> heard <S%H8085><s%> of this <S%H2088><s%> matter, <S%H1697><s%> he tried <S%H1245><s%> to kill <S%H2026><s%> Moses. <S%H4872><s%> But Moses <S%H4872><s%> fled <S%H1272><s%> from the presence <S%H6440><s%> of Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> and settled <S%H3427><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%> of Midian; <S%H4080><s%> and he sat <S%H3427><s%> down <S%H3427><s%> by a well. <S%H875><s%>

Now the priest <S%H3548><s%> of Midian <S%H4080><s%> had seven <S%H7651><s%> daughters; <S%H1323><s%> and they came <S%H935><s%> to draw <S%H1802><s%> water, <S%H1802><s%> and filled <S%H4390><s%> the troughs <S%H7298><s%> to water <S%H8248><s%> their father's flock. <S%H6629><s%>

Then the shepherds <S%H7462><s%> came <S%H935><s%> and drove <S%H1644><s%> them away, <S%H1644><s%> but Moses <S%H4872><s%> stood <S%H6965><s%> up and helped <S%H3467><s%> them, and watered <S%H8248><s%> their flock. <S%H6629><s%>
When they came <S%H935><s%> to Reuel <S%H7467><s%> their father, he said, <S%H1><s%> "Why <S%H559><s%> have you come <S%H4069><s%> [back] so soon <S%H935><s%> today <S%H4116><s%>?"

So they said, <S%H559><s%> "An Egyptian <S%H4713><s%> delivered <S%H5337><s%> us from the hand <S%H3027><s%> of the shepherds; <S%H7462><s%> and what <S%H1571><s%> is more, <S%H1571><s%> he even <S%H1571><s%> drew <S%H1802><s%> the water <S%H1802><s%> for us and watered <S%H8248><s%> the flock. <S%H6629><s%>"

And he said <S%H559><s%> to his daughters, <S%H1323><s%> "Where <S%H335><s%> is he then? Why <S%H4100><s%> is it that you have left <S%H5800><s%> the man <S%H376><s%> behind <S%H5800><s%>? Invite <S%H7121><s%> him to have something <S%H3899><s%> to eat. <S%H398><s%>"
And Moses <S%H4872><s%> was willing <S%H2974><s%> to dwell <S%H3427><s%> with the man, <S%H376><s%> and he gave <S%H5414><s%> his daughter <S%H1323><s%> Zipporah <S%H6855><s%> to Moses. <S%H4872><s%>

Then she gave <S%H3205><s%> birth <S%H3205><s%> to a son, <S%H1121><s%> and he named <S%H7121><s%> <S%H8034><s%> him Gershom, <S%H1647><s%> for he said, <S%H559><s%> "I have been <S%H1961><s%> a sojourner <S%H1616><s%> in a foreign <S%H5237><s%> land. <S%H776><s%>"

Now it came <S%H1961><s%> about in [the course of] those <S%H1992><s%> many <S%H7227><s%> days <S%H3117><s%> that the king <S%H4428><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%> died. <S%H4191><s%> And the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> sighed <S%H584><s%> because <S%H4480><s%> of the bondage, <S%H5656><s%> and they cried <S%H2199><s%> out; and their cry <S%H7775><s%> for help <S%H7775><s%> because <S%H4480><s%> of [their] bondage <S%H5656><s%> rose <S%H5927><s%> up to God. <S%H430><s%>

So God <S%H430><s%> heard <S%H8085><s%> their groaning; <S%H5009><s%> and God <S%H430><s%> remembered <S%H2142><s%> His covenant <S%H1285><s%> with Abraham, <S%H85><s%> Isaac, <S%H3327><s%> and Jacob. <S%H3290><s%>
And God <S%H430><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Israel, <S%H3478><s%> and God <S%H430><s%> took <S%H3045><s%> notice <S%H3045><s%> [of them.]
